info.description:
This is version 1.0 of our API for updating payment holiday activity for a loan account. A payment holiday is a temporary break from regular loan repayments. Banks may offer payment holidays to help customers through periods of economic disruption, and are an important part of pandemic response plans in many countries.


This API enables you to update payment holiday activity for a:



 - Mortgage loan
 - Home loan
 - Personal loan
 - Small business loan
 - Credit line

**Note:** To use this API, request an API key from the Temenos [Base Camp community](https://basecamp.temenos.com/). Create an account with the community to get started.
info.title: Updating payment holiday activity for a loan account

post.summary: Update payment holiday activity for a mortgage loan
post.description: Update payment holiday activity for a mortgage loan.

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: This identifier indicates if the account details should be validated or not.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: This identifier is needed for customer data protection. It identifies the lead company - the entity, company or bank branch - that's behind a particular customer contract. Example: US0010001.

code.description: The code related to override message.

responseCode.description: The user input to accept/reject the override.

properties.description: Input is the valid field name for the metrics evaluation of alerts.

propertyId.description: The identifier of the product condition.

overrides.description: Captures the override message that was generated when the transaction was committed to the database.

override.description: Captures the override message that was generated when the transaction was committed to the database.

productId.description: Contains the unique identifier of the product, for example, the product id of the arrangement account.

masterArrangementId.description: A unique identifier that specifies an arrangement reference. This acts as a Master for the arrangement that is being created.

currencyId.description: Identifier of the currency. This is the 3-letter ISO 4217 code for the currency. For example, GBP or USD.

effectiveDate.description: The date on which the principal movement is effected.

activityId.description: The identifier of the activity, for example, ACCOUNTS-CAPITALISE-ACCHARGE*CARDISSUEFEE

transactionAmount.description: This contains the transaction amount. This is based on either the local currency or a foreign currency.

billType.description: The type of payment obligation generated.
